page.title: 11The Memorial Hall, Ceres
page.content: Ceres Memorial Hall was originally a church but it was converted into a community hall. It is used regularly in mornings and evenings for various activities. The Playgroup make use of the hall on two mornings a week and the Mother and Toddler group have one morning. In the evenings it is used by the Badminton Club, the Highland Dancing Class and the Youth Club and sometimes there are discos on Friday evenings. Every year there is an Annual General Meeting held in the Hall to get new members for the committee. The letting fees and the proceeds from a Christmas Fete which is held every year help to cover the cost of heating, cleaning and repairs.
